p.s: The given sonnet Sonnet 65 was written by William Shakespeare.
The sonnet has 14 lines which can be seperatedseparated in three verses of four and a couplet at the end.
The metre of the sonnet is an iambic pentameter, which means that every line has ten syllables and there is always every seonc line emphasized.
The rhyme of the sonnet can be divided in ABAB, CDCD, EFEF, GG.
The addressee of the sonnet could be every reader and the intention of Shakespeare is to convince the reader from his opinion.
The mainly theme is that nothing can beat the time.
In first, Shakespeare tells the reader that even things that are supposed to be not mortal loses his power with the time.
Also beauty can notcannot resist mortality.
After that he gets deeper into the theme and asks himself how can summer be forever when there is time.
He also tells about rocks and steel which both loses his impregnability with the time.
Afterwards, Shakespeare writes that even jewels, power and beauty cannot resist the effects of the time.
In the last couplet, Shakespeare explains that even if nothing can resist the time, he still loves to write.
